intro: Diosma oblonga, commonly known as the narrowleaf diosma, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and has been traditionally used in herbal medicine. Diosma oblonga thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
